title: Need a "-d" option for spack buildcache list which is similar to spack find -d
body:
### Request Summary
<!--*Please add a concise summary of your suggestion here.*-->
We would require a switch option to display the dependencies of binary packages:- `$ spack buildcache list -d`
This would behave in the same way as `$ spack find -d`

### Problem Summary
<!--*Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe it!*-->
We have created a new package request for MVAPICH2-GDR: [link](https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/17883) which is dependent on different versions of cuda. The package is not installable and is only available through a binary mirror. 

Currently there is no way for users to find out what the dependencies of the binaries are available in the mirror. Having a "-d" option like in `spack find -d` will allow users to find out the dependencies of binaries and install the correct spec from the mirror.

Currently, when I want to list all the binaries using $ `spack buildcache list`, it looks like there are duplicates. However, they are each dependent on different versions of cuda:-
```
[packager@fs5 gdrmirror2]$ spack --version
0.15.1-195-0c44a9a
[packager@fs5 gdrmirror2]$ spack buildcache list -L -v -a
==> Finding buildcaches at file:///home/packager/spack-related/gdrmirror2/build_cache
-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / gcc@4.8.5 -----------------------------
s63wh7pvmewqo5cxdoh7hksahdlfv7lx mvapich2-gdr@2.3.3~core_direct+mcast~openacc distribution=mofed4.5 pmi_version=pmi1 process_managers=mpirun
6c2ve3pwz4o5exnrjtwpsre36dfsnnmh mvapich2-gdr@2.3.3~core_direct+mcast~openacc distribution=mofed4.5 pmi_version=pmi1 process_managers=mpirun
nk22bqghyg3b3sitsklq3fv3z5aobhvc mvapich2-gdr@2.3.3~core_direct+mcast~openacc distribution=mofed4.5 pmi_version=pmi1 process_managers=mpirun
```

### Alternate Methods

I tried using a wrapper around the cuda dependency like [here](https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/17883/files/018fc7cf9cbc575c601a54d01e010c6e3488cf64) but was advised to make this feature request.

### Additional information
<!--*Add any other context about the feature request here.*-->


### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
